signal_description: From the table 'defaultview-222', get the sum of all values in the 'AR_CountDocuments' column.
llm_output:
Here is the summary of the given SIGNAL query in a human-readable format:

{
  "signal_description": "From the table 'defaultview-222', get the sum of all values in the 'AR_CountDocuments' column."
}

To generate this summary, I first looked at the main query keywords:

- SELECT indicates that values will be retrieved from the table
- SUM() specifies that an aggregate function will be applied to aggregate the values
- The column name inside SUM() shows which column will be aggregated - 'AR_CountDocuments'
- FROM indicates the table name that will be queried - 'defaultview-222'

Putting this all together, I can summarize that this query will:

- Look at the table 'defaultview-222'
- Retrieve values from the 'AR_CountDocuments' column 
- Calculate the sum of all those values

So in simple terms, it will get the sum of all values in the 'AR_CountDocuments' column from the 'defaultview-222' table.
llm_input:

the column names and respective values if they are used in the Signal query.

FROM "defaultview-222"
